1. Filon was known for being strict but fair in his teachings as a tram driving instructor. He held his trainees to high standards and expected them to put in the necessary effort to become skilled drivers.
2. He was highly knowledgeable about the inner workings of trams and was able to effectively convey this knowledge to his trainees.
3. Filon was known for his calm and level-headed demeanor, which helped to keep his trainees relaxed and focused during their lessons.
4. He often used real-life scenarios to illustrate important concepts and would take his trainees on practice runs to give them hands-on experience.
5. Despite his strictness, Filon was well-liked by his trainees and was seen as a dedicated and patient teacher who truly cared about their success. Many of his trainees went on to become successful tram drivers themselves.
